text: Once there was a hand mirror that when it was left alone and no one saw it in it it felt the worst, as if it did not exist, and perhaps it was right; but the other mirrors mocked it, and when at night they kept them in the same dresser's drawer they slept on their own free legs satisfied, unconcerned by the neurotic.
title: El espejo que no podía dormir
author: Augusto Monterroso
